what-is-a-stock.title: Stock kya hai?
what-is-a-stock.description: Chalo, bilkul basics se shuru karte hain. Stock kya hai aur yeh market ka fundamental building block kyun hai, yeh samjho.
what-is-a-stock.simpleDefinitionP1: Essentially, ek stock (jise share ya equity bhi kehte hain) ek type ki security hai jo ek corporation mein ownership signify karti hai aur corporation ke assets aur earnings ke ek hisse par claim represent karti hai.
what-is-a-stock.simpleDefinitionP2: Saral shabdon mein, jab aap kisi company ka stock khareedte hain, to aap us company ka ek chota sa tukda khareed rahe hote hain. Aap ek part-owner, ya shareholder ban jaate hain.
what-is-a-stock.ownershipVisualP1: Pizza ka har slice company ke stock ka ek share represent karta hai.
what-is-a-stock.ownershipVisualP2: Jab aap ek share khareedte hain, to aap us pizza ka ek slice khareed rahe hote hain. Aap ek part-owner ban jaate hain!
what-is-a-stock.whyCompaniesIssue: Companies stock kyun issue karti hain?
what-is-a-stock.whyCompaniesIssueP1: Companies fun ke liye ownership nahi de deti. Woh stock ek primary reason ke liye issue karti hain: capital (paisa) raise karne ke liye.
what-is-a-stock.fundingGrowthP: Ek company ko naye factories banane, naye products develop karne, naye markets mein expand karne, ya aur logon ko hire karne ke liye paiso ki zaroorat ho sakti hai. Stock bechne se debt mein jaaye bina yeh sab karne ke liye cash mil jaata hai.
what-is-a-stock.goingPublicP: Jab ek private company pehli baar apne shares public ko bechti hai, to use Initial Public Offering (IPO) kehte hain. Yeh ek major event hai jo badi matra mein capital raise kar sakta hai aur company ki prestige aur public profile badha sakta hai.
what-is-a-stock.whyPeopleBuyP: Investors profit kamane ki expectation se stock khareedte hain, jo do main tarikon se ho sakta hai:
what-is-a-stock.capitalGainsP: Agar company achha perform karti hai, to uski value badhti hai, aur uske stock ki price bhi. Fir aap apne shares unki khareedi hui keemat se zyada mein bech sakte hain. Is profit ko capital gain kehte hain.
what-is-a-stock.dividendsP: Kuch companies apne profits ka ek hissa apne shareholders ke saath share karti hain. In payments ko dividends kehte hain. Yeh investors ko ek regular income stream provide karte hain.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway1: Ek stock company mein ownership represent karta hai.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway2: Companies growth aur operations ke liye paisa raise karne ke liye stock issue karti hain.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway3: Investors potentially capital gains aur dividends ke zariye paisa kamane ke liye stock khareedte hain.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway4: Stock own karne ka matlab hai aap ek shareholder hain aur company ke assets par aapka claim hai.
what-is-a-stock.term1: Shareholder: Ek individual ya institution jo company mein shares own karta hai.
what-is-a-stock.term2: IPO (Initial Public Offering): Pehli baar jab ek private company apne shares public ko offer karti hai.
what-is-a-stock.term3: Capital Gains: Ek investment ki sale se hua profit.
what-is-a-stock.term4: Dividends: Ek company ki earnings ka ek portion jo uske shareholders ko pay kiya jaata hai.

different-types-of-stocks.title: Alag Alag Tarah ke Stocks
different-types-of-stocks.description: Sabhi stocks ek jaise nahi hote. Yeh lesson aapko stocks ki alag-alag categories se introduce karega, jisse aap unke unique characteristics aur risk profiles ko samajh payenge.

commonVsPreferred.title: Common vs. Preferred Stocks
commonVsPreferred.p1: Common Stock: Jab log stocks ke baare mein baat karte hain to zyada tar yahi matlab hota hai. Yeh voting rights deta hai, jisse shareholders ko company ke decisions mein apni baat kehne ka mauka milta hai. Common stockholders ko dividends mil sakte hain, lekin yeh guaranteed nahi hain.
commonVsPreferred.p2: Preferred Stock: In stocks mein aam taur par voting rights nahi hote. Lekin, yeh typically ek fixed dividend pay karte hain jo common stock dividends se pehle pay kiya jaata hai. Liquidation ke case mein, preferred stockholders ka company assets par zyada claim hota hai.

byMarketCap.title: Market Capitalization ke Hisab se Classification
byMarketCap.p1: Large-Cap Stocks: Yeh badi, well-established companies ke stocks hain jinka market capitalization $10 billion se zyada hai. Inhe aam taur par kam risky mana jaata hai.
byMarketCap.p2: Mid-Cap Stocks: Yeh un companies ke stocks hain jinka market capitalization $2 billion se $10 billion ke beech hai. Yeh growth potential aur stability ka balance offer karte hain.
byMarketCap.p3: Small-Cap Stocks: Yeh chhoti companies ke stocks hain jinka market capitalization $300 million se $2 billion ke beech hai. Inme high growth potential hota hai lekin high risk bhi hota hai.

byStyle.title: Investment Style ke Hisab se Classification
byStyle.p1: Growth Stocks: Yeh un companies ke stocks hain jinke market mein average se zyada rate se grow karne ki umeed hai. Yeh aksar dividends nahi dete, kyunki yeh expansion ke liye earnings ko reinvest karte hain.
byStyle.p2: Value Stocks: Yeh aise stocks hain jo apne fundamentals, jaise ki earnings, sales, aur book value ke comparison mein kam price par trade karte hain. Yeh aksar investors dwara nazarandaaz kiye jaate hain aur undervalued ho sakte hain.

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.item1: Stocks ko broadly common aur preferred stocks mein categorize kiya ja sakta hai, har ek ke alag rights aur benefits hote hain.
keyTakeaways.item2: Market capitalization (large-cap, mid-cap, small-cap) ek stock ke risk aur growth potential ko assess karne mein ek key factor hai.
keyTakeaways.item3: Investment style (growth vs. value) investors ko apne financial goals aur risk tolerance ke saath apne stock choices align karne mein help karta hai.

what-is-a-stock-market.title: Stock Market kya hai?
what-is-a-stock-market.description: Us central marketplace ko discover karein jahan stocks khareede aur beche jaate hain, aur economy mein uske vital role ko samjhein.

analogy.title: Ek Simple Analogy: The Supermarket
analogy.p1: Stock market ko ek giant, well-organized supermarket ki tarah socho. Lekin fruits, vegetables, aur groceries bechne ke bajaye, yeh publicly listed companies ke stocks (ownership ke tukde) bechta hai.

supermarket.title: Ek Supermarket...
supermarket.p: Buyers (shoppers) ko sellers (farmers, brands) se connect karta hai.

stockMarket.title: Ek Stock Market...
stockMarket.p: Buyers (investors) ko sellers (dusre investors ya companies) se connect karta hai.

coreFunctions.title: Stock Market ke Core Functions
coreFunctions.p1: Stock market do primary functions serve karta hai jo economy ke liye crucial hain:

item1.title: Buyers aur Sellers ko Connect Karna
item1.p: Yeh ek centralized, regulated, aur transparent platform provide karta hai jahan jo log stock khareedna chahte hain woh aasani se unhe bechne walon ko dhoond sakte hain. Isse liquidity create hoti hai, jisse investments mein enter aur exit karna aasan ho jaata hai.

item2.title: Capital Formation ko Facilitate Karna
item2.p: Yeh companies ko public ko ownership stakes (stocks) bechkar paisa (capital) raise karne ki anumati deta hai. Is capital ko fir business grow karne, jobs create karne, aur innovate karne ke liye use kiya jaata hai.

takeaways.item1: Stock market stocks khareedne aur bechne ke liye ek centralized marketplace hai.
takeaways.item2: Yeh liquidity provide karta hai, jisse stocks trade karna aasan ho jaata hai.
takeaways.item3: Yeh capital formation ke liye crucial hai, companies ko grow karne ke liye paisa raise karne mein help karta hai.

how-stocks-are-traded.title: Stocks Kaise Trade Hote Hain
how-stocks-are-traded.description: Primary aur secondary markets ke beech ke difference ko samajhne ke liye behind the scenes jaayein, aur har transaction mein involved key players ko jaanein.

primarySecondary.title: Primary vs. Secondary Markets
primarySecondary.p1: Stock trading do alag-alag markets mein hoti hai:

primary.title: The Primary Market
primary.p: Yahan stocks paida hote hain. Jab ek company Initial Public Offering (IPO) hold karti hai, to woh apne shares સીधे investors ko pehli baar bechti hai. Paisa સીधे company ko jaata hai.

secondary.title: The Secondary Market
secondary.p: Ise hi hum aam taur par 'the stock market' kehte hain. Yahan investors company ke involvement ke bina aapas mein stocks trade karte hain. Price supply aur demand se determine hoti hai.

exchanges.title: Stock Exchanges
exchanges.p: Yeh organized marketplaces hain jahan trading hoti hai. India mein, do main exchanges hain National Stock Exchange (NSE) aur Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

brokers.title: Brokers
brokers.p: Retail investors exchange par સીधे trade nahi kar sakte. Unhe apne behalf par trades execute karne ke liye ek licensed intermediary chahiye jise stockbroker (jaise Zerodha, Upstox, etc.) kehte hain.

takeaways.item1: Primary Market naye stocks (IPOs) ke liye hai, jahan paisa company ko jaata hai.
takeaways.item2: Secondary Market woh jagah hai jahan investors ek dusre ke saath existing stocks trade karte hain.
takeaways.item3: Aapko NSE aur BSE jaise major stock exchanges par trade karne ke liye ek broker ki zaroorat hai.

reading-a-stock-quote.title: Stock Quote Padhna
reading-a-stock-quote.description: Ek stock ke performance aur valuation ko jaldi se samajhne ke liye stock quote mein numbers aur symbols ko decode karna seekhein.
reading-a-stock-quote.intro: Ek stock quote ek stock ki essential financial information ka ek snapshot hai. Yeh pehli baar mein numbers ka jumble lag sakta hai, lekin ek baar aapko pata chal jaaye ki kya dekhna hai, to ise samajhna aasan hai.
reading-a-stock-quote.imageCaption: Ek fictional company, 'Innovate Corp.' ke liye ek typical stock quote.

price.def: Stock ke ek share ke liye current market price.

change.def: Pichle din ke close se stock ki price mein change, jo absolute value aur percentage dono mein dikhaya gaya hai.

volume.def: Current din ke dauran trade hue total shares ki sankhya. High volume high interest indicate karta hai.

marketCap.def: Company ke sabhi shares ki total value. Iski calculation stock price ko total number of shares se multiply karke ki jaati hai.

takeaways.item1: Ek stock quote ek stock ke current trading data ka ek quick summary provide karta hai.
takeaways.item2: Key metrics mein price, change, volume, aur market cap shaamil hain.
takeaways.item3: In terms ko samajhna ek stock ke performance ko analyze karne ka pehla step hai.

bull-vs-bear-markets.title: Bull vs. Bear Markets
bull-vs-bear-markets.description: Do major market trends aur unhe define karne wale investor sentiment ko samjhein.
bull-vs-bear-markets.intro: Aap aksar commentators ko 'bull' aur 'bear' markets ke baare mein baat karte sunenge. Yeh terms market ki overall direction aur mood ko describe karte hain.

bear.title: Bear Market
bear.subtitle: Market sust pada hai.
bear.char1: Prices gir rahi hain (typically 20% ya usse zyada)

takeaways.item1: Ek Bull Market badhti prices aur optimism se characterized hota hai.
takeaways.item2: Ek Bear Market girti prices aur pessimism se characterized hota hai.
takeaways.item3: Yeh trends cyclical hain aur market ka ek natural part hain.

market-indices.title: Market Indices (Sensex & Nifty)
market-indices.description: Jaanein ki market indices stock market ki overall health ke liye ek barometer ke roop mein kaise kaam karte hain.
market-indices.intro: Ek market index stocks ke ek specific group ke performance ka ek statistical measure hai. Yeh market ki health aur direction ka ek snapshot provide karta hai. India mein, do sabse famous indices hain:

sensex.title: BSE Sensex
sensex.p1: Sensex Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) ka benchmark index hai.
sensex.p2: Ismein exchange par 30 sabse bade aur sabse actively-traded stocks shaamil hain, jo overall market ka ek sample provide karte hain.

nifty.title: NSE Nifty 50
nifty.p1: Nifty 50 National Stock Exchange (NSE) ka benchmark index hai.
nifty.p2: Ismein 50 sabse badi Indian companies shaamil hain, jo economy ke ek broad cross-section ko represent karti hain.

takeaways.item1: Sensex aur Nifty jaise market indices overall market ke liye ek barometer ke roop mein kaam karte hain.
takeaways.item2: BSE Sensex 30 major stocks ko track karta hai.
takeaways.item3: NSE Nifty 50 50 major stocks ko track karta hai.

role-of-sebi.title: SEBI ka Role
role-of-sebi.description: Indian stock market ke watchdog se milo: Securities and Exchange Board of India.
role-of-sebi.intro: Stock market ek free-for-all nahi hai. Yeh ek highly regulated environment hai, aur India mein chief regulator SEBI (Securities and Exchange Board of India) hai.

item1.title: Investors ko Protect Karna
item1.p: Yeh sunishchit karna ki market fair hai aur investors ke saath cheat nahi hota hai.

item2.title: Market ko Develop Karna
item2.p: Securities market ke growth aur health ko promote karna.

item3.title: Intermediaries ko Regulate Karna
item3.p: Brokers, exchanges, aur dusre players ke conduct ko oversee karna.

takeaways.item1: SEBI Indian securities market ka main regulator hai.
takeaways.item2: Iska core mission investors ko protect karna hai.
takeaways.item3: SEBI market fair, transparent, aur efficient ho, yeh sunishchit karne ke liye rules set karta hai.

stockMarketCourse.title: Stock Market Course
stockMarketCourse.description: Ek savvy investor banne ka aapka safar yahan se shuru hota hai.

module1.title: Module 1: The Basics
module1.description: Stock market ke fundamental concepts aur uske components ko seekhein.

module2.title: Module 2: Market Kaise Kaam Karta Hai
module2.description: Stock market ko shape dene wali forces aur entities ko samjhein.

module3.title: Module 3: Market Mein Aapke Pehle Kadam
module3.description: Ek naye investor ko unki trading journey shuru karne ke liye practical, step-by-step guide provide karna.

module4.title: Module 4: Stock Selection ki Kala: Fundamental Analysis
module4.description: Learner ko ek company ki financial health analyze karne aur uski intrinsic value determine karne ke skills se equip karna.

module5.title: Module 5: Timing ka Vigyan: Technical Analysis
module5.description: Price action aur volume ke aadhar par market trends aur potential trading opportunities ko pehchanne ke liye technical analysis ke principles ko introduce karna.

module6.title: Module 6: Advanced Instruments aur Strategies
module6.description: Hedging aur speculation mein unke primary uses ke liye financial derivatives (futures aur options) ka introduction provide karna.

module7.title: Module 7: Ek Resilient Portfolio Banana aur Manage Karna
module7.description: Ek long-term investment portfolio banane, manage karne, aur maintain karne ke liye ek holistic approach mein sabhi seekhe gaye concepts ko synthesize karna.

opening-a-demat-and-trading-account.title: Demat aur Trading Account Kholna
opening-a-demat-and-trading-account.description: Stock market mein aapka pravesh dwar. Yeh lesson India mein investing aur trading shuru karne ke liye zaroori do essential accounts ko break down karta hai.
opening-a-demat-and-trading-account.intro: Aap apna pehla stock khareedne ya bechne se pehle, aapko do key accounts set up karne honge. Woh complex lag sakte hain, lekin woh bahut alag aur saral uddeshyon ki purti karte hain. Unhe ek hi ghar ke do alag-alag darwazon ke roop mein socho.

dematAccount.title: The Demat Account: Aapka Digital Vault
dematAccount.p1: Ek Demat Account (Dematerialized Account ka short form) aapke securities ke liye ek digital vault ya bank account jaisa hai. Physical share certificates rakhne ke bajaye, aapke stocks, bonds, mutual funds, aur dusre investments ek electronic (dematerialized) format mein rakhe jaate hain.
dematAccount.purpose: Uddeshya: Apne investments ko securely hold karna.
dematAccount.analogy: Analogy: Yeh woh locker hai jahan aap apne financial assets store karte hain.

tradingAccount.title: The Trading Account: Aapka Marketplace Access
tradingAccount.p1: Ek Trading Account stock exchanges (jaise NSE aur BSE) se aapka link hai. Yeh woh account hai jise aap actually stocks aur dusri securities ke liye buy aur sell orders place karne ke liye use karte hain.
tradingAccount.purpose: Uddeshya: Transactions (buy aur sell orders) execute karna.
tradingAccount.analogy: Analogy: Yeh woh shopping cart hai jise aap financial supermarket mein items khareedne ya bechne ke liye use karte hain.

howTheyWork.title: Woh Ek Saath Kaise Kaam Karte Hain
howTheyWork.step1: Step 1: Aap apne Trading Account ke through ek 'buy' order place karte hain.
howTheyWork.step2: Step 2: Funds aapke linked bank account se le liye jaate hain.
howTheyWork.step3: Step 3: Shares stock exchange par khareede jaate hain.
howTheyWork.step4: Step 4: Khareede gaye shares safekeeping ke liye aapke Demat Account mein deposit kiye jaate hain.
howTheyWork.sellProcess: Bechne ka process ulta hai: aap apne Trading Account se bechte hain, aur shares aapke Demat Account se nikal liye jaate hain.

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.item1: Indian stock market mein invest karne ke liye aapko Demat aur Trading Account dono ki zaroorat hai.
keyTakeaways.item2: Ek Demat Account aapke shares ko electronically HOLD karta hai.
keyTakeaways.item3: Ek Trading Account aapke buy aur sell orders ko EXECUTES karta hai.
keyTakeaways.item4: Aajkal zyada tar brokers ek convenient 2-in-1 account offer karte hain jo dono ko combine karta hai.

placing-your-first-trade-order-types.title: Placing Your First Trade: Order Types

the-different-players-in-the-market.title: The Different Players in the Market

using-key-financial-ratios-eps-p/e-p/b-r.title: Zaroori Financial Ratios ka istemal (EPS, P/E, P/B, ROE)
using-key-financial-ratios-eps-p/e-p/b-r.description: Numbers mein chupi kahaniyon ko unlock karein. Yeh lesson aapko company ki health, profitability, aur value evaluate karne ke liye char sabse powerful financial ratios ka istemal karna sikhayega.
using-key-financial-ratios-eps-p/e-p/b-r.intro: Financial statements raw data se bhare hote hain. Iska matlab samajhne ke liye, hum financial ratios ka istemal karte hain. Yeh simple calculations hain jo hamein companies compare karne, performance analyze karne, aur informed investment decisions lene mein madad karti hain. Chalo, char zaroori ratios mein dive karte hain.

eps.title: 1. Earnings Per Share (EPS): Profitability ka Snapshot
eps.p1: Yeh kya hai: EPS batata hai ki ek company apne stock ke har share ke liye kitna profit kamati hai. Yeh per-share basis par company ki profitability ka ek fundamental measure hai.
eps.formula: Formula: EPS = (Net Income - Preferred Dividends) / Average Outstanding Shares
eps.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Ek higher EPS aam taur par ek zyada profitable company ka sign hai. Isse bhi important, time ke saath EPS mein consistent growth ek strong positive sign hai.
eps.example: Agar Company A ka net income ₹10 Crore hai, koi preferred dividends nahi hain, aur 1 Crore outstanding shares hain, to uska EPS ₹10 hai.

pe.title: 2. Price-to-Earnings (P/E) Ratio: Valuation-Checker
pe.p1: Yeh kya hai: P/E ratio ek company ke current share price ko uske earnings per share se compare karta hai. Yeh sabse zyada use kiye jaane wale valuation metrics mein se ek hai.
pe.formula: Formula: P/E Ratio = Market Price per Share / Earnings Per Share (EPS)
pe.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Yeh indicate karta hai ki investors ek company ki earnings ke har rupee ke liye kitna pay karne ko taiyar hain.
pe.highPe: Ek High P/E suggest kar sakta hai ki investors ko future mein high growth ki umeed hai (lekin iska matlab yeh bhi ho sakta hai ki stock overvalued hai).
pe.lowPe: Ek Low P/E indicate kar sakta hai ki ek stock undervalued hai, ya company ko challenges face karne pad rahe hain.
pe.comparison: Yeh sabse zyada useful tab hota hai jab same industry ki companies ko compare kiya ja raha ho.

pb.title: 3. Price-to-Book (P/B) Ratio: 'Net Worth' ka Multiple
pb.p1: Yeh kya hai: P/B ratio ek company ke market capitalization ko uske book value se compare karta hai. Book value ek company ki net asset value hoti hai, jo Total Assets - Total Liabilities karke calculate ki jaati hai.
pb.formula: Formula: P/B Ratio = Market Price per Share / Book Value per Share
pb.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Yeh aapko samajhne mein madad karta hai ki kya aap company ke assets ki book value ke hisab se a fair price pay kar rahe hain.
pb.value: 1 se kam P/B ratio aksar ek potentially undervalued stock ka sign mana jaata hai. Yeh khas karke un companies ko value karne ke liye useful hai jinke paas significant tangible assets hain, jaise banks ya manufacturing firms.

roe.title: 4. Return on Equity (ROE): Efficiency ka Engine
roe.p1: Yeh kya hai: ROE measure karta hai ki ek company ka management shareholders ke paise ka kitna effectively profits generate karne ke liye istemal kar raha hai.
roe.formula: Formula: ROE = Net Income / Total Shareholder Equity
roe.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Ek higher ROE suggest karta hai ki company apne equity base se profit generate karne mein zyada efficient hai.
roe.consistency: Kai saalon tak ek stable aur high ROE dekho. Ek consistently high ROE (jaise, 15-20% se upar) aksar ek quality company ki pehchan hoti hai.

summaryTable.title: Quick Comparison Table
summaryTable.pbRule: 1 se kam value indicate kar sakta hai.
summaryTable.roeRule: Consistently high ek accha sign hai.

takeaways.title: Key Takeaways
takeaways.item1: EPS aapko ek company ke per-share profit ke baare mein batata hai.
takeaways.item2: P/E Ratio aapko yeh samajhne mein madad karta hai ki kya ek stock apni earnings ke relative overvalued ya undervalued hai.
takeaways.item3: P/B Ratio stock price ko company ki book value se compare karta hai, jo asset-heavy industries ke liye useful hai.
takeaways.item4: ROE batata hai ki ek company shareholder investments se kitna accha profit generate kar rahi hai.
takeaways.item5: Koi ek ratio poori kahani nahi batata. Ek complete picture ke liye unhe ek saath istemal karein.

introduction-to-derivatives.title: Derivatives ka Parichay
introduction-to-derivatives.description: Samjhein ki derivatives kya hain, unke alag-alag prakar, aur financial markets mein unka kya role hai.

section1.title: Derivative Kya Hai?
section1.p1: Ek derivative do ya do se zyada parties ke beech ek financial contract hai jiski value ek pehle se tay underlying financial asset (jaise stock ya bond) ya assets ke set (jaise index) par aadharit hoti hai. Derivative khud ek contract hai, aur iski value underlying asset ke price mein utaar-chadhav se 'derive' hoti hai.
section1.p2: Ise kisi cheez ke future price par ek shart ki tarah socho. Aap asset khud nahi khareed rahe hain, balki ek contract khareed rahe hain jo asset ke price change ke aadhar par pay out karega.

introduction-to-derivatives.animation_placeholder_1: Animation: Ek sadharan diagram jo ek stock (underlying asset) aur ek contract (derivative) dikhata hai jiski value stock ke price se judi hui hai.

section2.title: Mukhya Avdharnayen: Underlying Asset aur Contract
section2.p1: Derivatives ko samajhne ke liye, do avdharnayen mahatvapurna hain:

item1.title: Underlying Asset
item1.text: Yeh woh financial instrument hai jis par derivative ki keemat aadharit hai. Yeh ek stock, bond, commodity (jaise sona ya tel), currency, ya byaj dar bhi ho sakti hai.

item2.title: The Contract
item2.text: Derivative khud ek kanooni roop se badhyakari samjhauta hai jo saude ki sharton ko nirdharit karta hai, jaise ki underlying asset ki matra, jis keemat par sauda hoga, aur saude ki tarikh.

section3.title: Aam Prakar ke Derivatives
section3.p1: Derivatives ke kai prakar hote hain, har ek ka apna uddeshya aur jokhim ka star hota hai. Char sabse aam prakar hain:

row1.col2: Bhavishya mein ek vishisht samay par ek pehle se nirdharit keemat par ek sampatti kharidne ya bechne ka anubandh.
row1.col3: Keemat parivartano ke khilaf hedging karna ya bhavishya ke keemat ke utaar-chadhav par anumaan lagana.

row2.col2: Dharak ko ek vishisht avadhi ke bhitar ek nishchit keemat par ek sampatti kharidne (call option) ya bechne (put option) ka adhikar deta hai, lekin dayitva nahi.
row2.col3: Hedging, anumaan, aur aay utpann karna.

row3.col2: Ek anubandh jahan do paksh ek nishchit avadhi ke liye nakad pravah ke kram ka vinimay karne ke liye sahmat hote hain.
row3.col3: Byaj dar jokhim ya mudra vinimay jokhim ka prabandhan karna.

row4.col2: Futures ke saman, lekin yeh do pakshon ke beech niji, anukoolit samjhaute hain aur ek exchange par trade nahi kiye jaate hain.
row4.col3: Ek vishesh bhavishya tithi ke liye vishisht jokhimon ko hedge karna.

section4.title: Log Derivatives ka Upyog Kyon Karte Hain?
section4.p1: Derivatives vittiya bazaron mein kai mahatvapurna karyon ko poora karte hain:
section4.item1: Hedging: Jokhim ko kam karne ya prabandhit karne ke liye. Udaharan ke liye, ek kisan apni fasal ke liye ek keemat lock karne ke liye ek futures anubandh ka upyog kar sakta hai, jo use girti keematon se bachata hai.
section4.item2: Anumaan: Ek sampatti ki keemat ki bhavishya ki disha par shart lagane ke liye. Anumaan lagane wale keemat parivartano se labh kamane ka lakshya rakhte hain.
section4.item3: Leverage: Derivatives व्यापारियों ko apekshakrit kam poonji ke saath ek badi position ko niyantrit karne ki anumati dete hain. Yeh sambhavit labh aur sambhavit nuksan dono ko badhata hai.
section4.item4: Arbitrage: Vibhinn bazaron mein ek hi sampatti ke keemat ke antar ka labh uthane ke liye.

section5.title: Derivatives ke Jokhim
section5.p1: Shaktishali hone ke bavajood, derivatives mehtvapurna jokhimon ke saath aate hain. Unki jatilta bade nuksan ka karan ban sakti hai, vishesh roop se jab leverage ka upyog kiya jaata hai. Nivesh karne se pehle underlying asset aur derivative anubandh ki sharton ko samajhna mahatvapurna hai.

introduction-to-derivatives.animation_placeholder_2: Animation: Ek seesaw leverage ka pradarshan karta hai - ek chhota input (poonji) ek bada movement (position ka aakar) banata hai, jo uchch return aur uchch nuksan dono ki sambhavna dikhata hai.
introduction-to-derivatives.conclusion: Derivatives jatil vittiya sadhan hain. Agle pathon mein, hum futures aur options ko aur adhik vistar se dekhenge.

understanding-options-contracts-calls-an.title: Options Contracts ko Samajhna: Calls aur Puts

introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.title: Hedging aur Speculation Strategies ka Parichay
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.description: Derivatives istemal karne ke do mukhya uddeshyon ko samjhein: risk kam karne ke liye hedging aur munafa kamane ke liye speculation. Yeh lesson inke beech ke antar ko saaf karta hai aur har ek ka example deta hai.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.introduction: Futures aur options jaise derivatives do mukhya uddeshyon ke liye istemal kiye ja sakte hain: hedging aur speculation. Jabki dono mein derivatives market mein position lena shamil hai, unke mool lakshya moolbhoot roop se alag hain. Hedging risk kam karne ke baare mein hai, jabki speculation munafa kamane ki ummeed mein risk lene ke baare mein hai. Is antar ko samajhna in instruments ko prabhavi dhang se istemal karne ke liye mahatvapurna hai.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.section1_p1: Hedging ek aisi strategy hai jo ek asset mein pratikool moolya ki gati ke jokhim ko kam karne ya kam karne ke liye design ki gayi hai. Ise ek tarah ka bima samjhein. Ek hedger ke paas pehle se hi ek underlying asset ka exposure hota hai aur woh sambhavit nuksan se bachne ke liye derivatives ka istemal karta hai.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.section1_l1: Lakshya: Maujooda position ko nuksan se bachana.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.section1_l2: Udaharan: Ek airline company, jo badhte hue fuel ke daamo se prabhavit hoti hai, ek keemat lock karne ke liye jet fuel ke liye futures contracts khareed sakti hai. Agar fuel ki keemat badhti hai, to futures contract par munafa unke hawai jahazon ke liye fuel ki badhi hui lagat ko aafaset kar dega.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.section2_p1: Doosri or, speculation ek asset ka trade karne, ya ek financial transaction karne ka kaam hai, jismein shuruaati kharch ka adhikansh ya sabhi hissa khone ka ek mahatvapurna jokhim hota hai, ek bade laabh ki apeksha mein. Speculators ke paas underlying asset ka koi maujooda exposure nahi hota hai; ve sirf uske bhavishya ke moolya ki disha par shart laga rahe hain.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.section2_p2: Udaharan: Ek trader jo maanta hai ki sone ki keemat badhne wali hai, woh ek gold futures contract khareed sakta hai. Unke paas koi sona nahi hai aur na hi ve iski delivery lene ka irada rakhte hain. Ve sirf is baat par shart laga rahe hain ki ve iske expire hone se pehle futures contract ko ek uchch moolya par bech sakte hain, is prakaar moolya ke antar par munafa kama sakte hain.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.section3_p1: Prathamik antar iraade ka hai. Ek hedger jokhim kam karna chahta hai, jabki ek speculator munafa ke liye jokhim uthana chahta hai. Hedgers ke paas bachane ke liye ek maujooda position hoti hai, jabki speculators ke paas nahi hoti. Hedging ko ek rakshatmak rananiti ke roop mein dekha ja sakta hai, jabki speculation ek aakramak rananiti hai.
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.conclusion_title: Nishkarsh: Ek hi Sikke ke Do Pehlu
introduction-to-hedging-and-speculation-.conclusion_p1: Hedging aur speculation dono derivatives market ke avashyak karya hain. Hedgers jokhim transfer karte hain, aur speculators us jokhim ko avshoshit karte hain, jisse market ko kushal banane wali taralta pradan hoti hai. Chahe aap apne nivesh ko surakshit rakhna chahte hon ya naye munafa ke avsaron ki talash mein hon, hedging aur speculation dono ko samajhna derivatives ki duniya mein navigate karne ke liye kunji hai.

asset-allocation-strategies.title: Asset Allocation Strategies
asset-allocation-strategies.description: Ek aisa portfolio banana seekhein jo aapke financial goals aur risk tolerance ke anuroop ho. Yeh lesson alag-alag asset allocation strategies ko cover karta hai, conservative se lekar aggressive tak.
asset-allocation-strategies.introduction: Asset allocation ek investor dwara liye jane wale sabse mahatvapurna nirnayon mein se ek hai. Yeh aapke portfolio ko alag-alag asset categories, jaise ki stocks, bonds, aur cash, ke beech vibhajit karne ki prakriya hai. Aap apne assets ko jis tarah se allocate karte hain, uska aapke long-term returns par kisi bhi single investment choice se zyada prabhav padta hai. Aapke liye sahi asset allocation strategy aapki vyaktigat paristhitiyon par nirbhar karegi, jismein aapki umra, financial goals, aur risk ke liye sahanubhuti shamil hai.
asset-allocation-strategies.section1_p1: Asset allocation ek investment strategy hai jiska uddeshya ek vyakti ke lakshyon, jokhim sahan shilta, aur nivesh kshitij ke anusaar ek portfolio ki sampatti ko vibhajit karke jokhim aur puraskar ko santulit karna hai. Teen mukhya sampatti varg hain:
asset-allocation-strategies.section1_l1: Stocks: Vikas ki adhik sambhavna, lekin jokhim bhi adhik.
asset-allocation-strategies.section1_l2: Bonds: Stocks se kam jokhim, adhik saumya return ke saath.
asset-allocation-strategies.section1_l3: Cash aur Cash Equivalents: Bahut kam jokhim, lekin return bhi bahut kam.
asset-allocation-strategies.section2_p1: Conservative Strategy: Yeh strategy kam jokhim sahan shilta wale niveshakon ke liye hai. Ek aam conservative portfolio 70% bonds, 20% stocks, aur 10% cash ho sakta hai.
asset-allocation-strategies.section2_p2: Moderate Strategy: Yeh madhyam jokhim sahan shilta wale niveshakon ke liye hai. Ek moderate portfolio 60% stocks aur 40% bonds ho sakta hai.
asset-allocation-strategies.section2_p3: Aggressive Strategy: Yeh uchch jokhim sahan shilta wale niveshakon ke liye hai jo uchch return chahte hain. Ek aggressive portfolio 80% stocks aur 20% bonds ho sakta hai.
asset-allocation-strategies.conclusion_p1: Asset allocation ek baar ka nirnay nahi hai. Apne portfolio ki samay-samay par samiksha karna aur use avashyakta anusar punah santulit karna mahatvapurna hai taki yeh sunishchit ho sake ki yeh aapke lakshyon ke anuroop bana rahe. Ek soch-samajhkar asset allocation strategy banakar, aap apne financial future ke liye ek thos neenv taiyar kar rahe hain.

risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.title: Risk Management: Position Sizing aur Stop-Loss Orders
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.description: Apne capital ko do sabse critical risk management techniques se bachana seekhein: position sizing aur stop-loss orders. Yeh lesson aapko har ek trade par apne risk ko control karna sikhayega.
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.introduction: Successful investing sirf winners chunne ke baare mein nahi hai; yeh losers ko manage karne ke baare mein hai. Effective risk management hi hai jo lagatar profitable traders ko unse alag karta hai jo wild swings aur ant mein nuksan ka anubhav karte hain. Ek trader ke risk management toolkit mein do sabse fundamental aur powerful tools hain position sizing aur stop-loss orders. Inmein maharat hasil karna aapke capital ko bacha sakta hai aur aapko lambe samay tak game mein बनाए rakh sakta hai.
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section1_title: Position Sizing: Kitna Risk Lena Hai?
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section1_p1: Position sizing ek single trade mein kitne shares kharidne ya bechne hain, yeh determine karne ka process hai. Yeh is baare mein nahi hai ki aapko *lagta* hai ki ek stock kitna upar jayega, balki is baare mein hai ki agar aap galat hue to aap kitna *khone* ke liye taiyar hain. Ek aam angoothe ka niyam 1% niyam hai:
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section1_l1: 1% Niyam: Ek single trade par apne total trading capital ka 1% se zyada risk kabhi na lein. Udaharan ke liye, agar aapke paas ₹1,00,000 ka portfolio hai, to aapko kisi ek trade par ₹1,000 se zyada ka risk nahi lena chahiye.
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section1_l2: Position Size Calculate Karna: Apni position size calculate karne ke liye, aapko apni entry price aur apni stop-loss price pata honi chahiye. Formula hai: Position Size = (Total Capital * Risk Percentage) / (Entry Price - Stop-Loss Price).
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section1_l3: Yeh Kyun Zaroori Hai: Sahi position sizing yeh sunishchit karta hai ki ek single bura trade aapke account ka ek significant hissa nahi mita dega. Yeh nuksan ko manage karne layak rakhta hai aur emotional decision-making ko rokta hai.
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section2_title: Stop-Loss Orders: Aapka Automated Safety Net
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section2_p1: Ek stop-loss order ek broker ke paas rakha gaya ek order hai jo ek security ko ek certain price par pahunchne par automatically bech deta hai. Iska design ek investor ke position par nuksan ko seemit karne ke liye kiya gaya hai. Udaharan ke liye, agar aap ₹100 par ek stock kharidte hain aur ₹95 par stop-loss set karte hain, to agar price ₹95 tak girti hai to aapka broker aapke shares ko automatically bech dega, jisse aapka nuksan 5% tak seemit ho jayega. Yeh ek losing position ko bechne ke decision se emotion ko bahar nikalne ke liye ek critical tool hai.
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section3_title: Position Sizing aur Stop-Losses ki Synergy
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.section3_p1: Position sizing aur stop-loss orders ek saath kaam karte hain. Aapka stop-loss position sizing equation ke 'risk' wale hisse ko determine karta hai. Aap andar aane se *pehle* kahan bahar niklenge yeh decide karke, aur usi ke anusaar apni position ko size karke, aap ek disciplined aur systematic tarike se apne risk par control kar rahe hain. Yeh combination aapko anivary roop se aane wali haraane wali lakeeron se bachne mein aur lambe samay tak profitable rehne mein madad karta hai.
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.conclusion_title: Nishkarsh: Agle Din Trade Karne ke liye Trade Karein
risk-management-position-sizing-and-stop.conclusion_p1: Risk management trading ka sabse glamorous hissa nahi hai, lekin yeh sabse mahatvapurna hai. Lagatar sound position sizing rules ko laagoo karke aur apne downside ko protect karne ke liye stop-loss orders ka istemal karke, aap yeh sunishchit karte hain ki aap apna capital bacha sakte hain aur agle din trade karne ke liye jeevit reh sakte hain. Yaad rakhein, lakshya har trade par sahi hona nahi hai, balki apne winners par apne losers par jitna aap khote hain usse zyada paisa kamana hai.

the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.title: Investor ka Dimag: Psychological Biases ko Manage Karna
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.description: Investment mein sabse bada dushman market nahi, balki aap khud hain. Yeh lesson un common psychological biases ko explore karta hai jo galat investment decisions ki taraf le jaate hain aur unhe door karne ke strategies batata hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.introduction: Investing ki duniya mein, aapki intelligence aur analytical skills zaroori hain, lekin aapka emotional discipline sabse upar hai. Behavioral finance ke field ne dikhaya hai ki investors hamesha rational nahi hote. Hum kai cognitive aur emotional biases ke shikar ho sakte hain jo hamare judgment ko dhundhla kar sakte hain aur mehenge galtiyon ka karan ban sakte hain. In biases ko samajhna unhe jeetne aur ek zyada disciplined, successful investor banne ka pehla kadam hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section1_p1: Psychological biases judgment mein norm ya rationality se deviation ke systematic patterns hain. Investing mein, yeh mental shortcuts ya emotional pitfalls hain jo hamein irrational decisions lene par majboor karte hain. Yeh aksar subconscious level par kaam karte hain, jo unhe khaas taur par khatarnak banata hai. Sabse common biases mein shamil hain:
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section1_l1: Confirmation Bias: Aisi information ko search karne, interpret karne aur favor karne ki tendency jo aapke maujooda beliefs ko confirm karti hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section1_l2: Overconfidence Bias: Apni kabiliyat aur apni information ki accuracy ko overestimate karna.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section1_l3: Herding Mentality: Dusre investors jo kar rahe hain, use follow aur copy karne ki tendency, chahe aapka apna analysis kuch bhi ho.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section1_l4: Loss Aversion: Ek equal gain ki khushi se zyada ek loss ka dard mehsus karna, jiski vajah se losing stocks ko bahut lamba time tak hold kiya jaata hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section1_l5: Anchoring Bias: Decisions lete waqt pehli piece of information ('anchor') par bahut zyada depend karna.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section1_l6: Recency Bias: Recent events ko bahut zyada weight dena aur unhe future mein extrapolate karna.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2_title: Action Mein Common Biases: Real-World Scenarios
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.1_title: Confirmation Bias: 'Yeh Stock Upar JANA HI Chahiye!'
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.1_p1: Scenario: Aap ek dost ki tip par ek stock kharidte hain. Stock ki price girne lagti hai. Re-evaluate karne ke bajaye, aap sirf un news articles aur forum posts ko padhte hain jo aapke initial decision ko support karte hain, negative reports ko ignore karte hue. Aap actively confirmation dhoondh rahe hain ki aap sahi the, bhale hi saboot badh rahe hon ki aap galat the.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.2_title: Overconfidence: 'Mujhe Pata Hai Winners Kaise Pick Karte Hain.'
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.2_p1: Scenario: Kuch successful trades ke baad, aapko lagne lagta hai ki aap mein stocks pick karne ka ek special talent hai. Aap zyada frequently trade karna shuru kar dete hain, bade risks lete hain, aur kam research karte hain, yeh maante hue ki aapki intuition hi kafi hai. Isse aksar warning signs ignore ho jaate hain aur jab market palat'ta hai to significant losses hote hain.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.3_title: Herding: 'Sab Ise Kharid Rahe Hain, Toh Yeh Achha Hi Hoga.'
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.3_p1: Scenario: Ek particular tech stock har taraf news mein hai, aur aapke social circle mein har koi use kharid raha hai. Fear of missing out (FOMO) shuru ho jaata hai, aur aap bina apna due diligence kiye bandwagon par kood jaate hain. Aap hype ke peak par kharidte hain, theek usse pehle jab bubble phat'ta hai aur price collapse ho jaati hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.4_title: Loss Aversion: 'Jaise Hi Break-Even Hoga, Main Ise Bech Dunga.'
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.4_p1: Scenario: Aap ek stock ₹200 par kharidte hain, aur woh ₹150 par gir jaata hai. Ek pehle se decide kiye gaye stop-loss ke basis par apne losses cut karne ke bajaye, aap use hold karte hain, yeh ummeed karte hue ki woh ₹200 par wapas aa jayega. Loss ko realize karne ka dar itna strong hota hai ki aap ek girti hui asset ko hold karte rehte hain, us capital ko bandh kar jo kahin aur behtar istemal ho sakta tha.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.5_title: Anchoring: 'Yeh ₹500 Ka Tha, Toh ₹300 Mein Yeh Sasta Hai.'
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section2.5_p1: Scenario: Ek stock jo kabhi ₹500 ke high par trade kar raha tha, ab ₹300 par aa gaya hai. Aap ₹500 price par anchor karte hain, yeh sochte hue ki stock sasta hai. Lekin, company ke fundamentals kharab ho chuke ho sakte hain, jo lower price ko justify karte hain. Purana high ab irrelevant hai, lekin anchor aapko nayi reality dekhne se rokta hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section3_title: Biases se Paar Paane ke Strategies
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section3_l1: Ek Investment Plan Banayein: Ek clear, written investment strategy banayein jismein defined goals, risk tolerance, aur kharidne-bechne ke rules hon. Us par tike rahein.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section3_l2: Apne Investing ko Automate Karein: Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) ka use karein to regularly ek fixed amount invest karein, jo emotion aur timing ko equation se hata deta hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section3_l3: Ek Investment Journal Rakhein: Har trade ke liye apne reasons document karein. Yeh aapko logically sochne par majboor karta hai aur aapko apne successes aur mistakes dono se seekhne mein madad karta hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section3_l4: Apne Portfolio ko Diversify Karein: Apne saare ande ek hi tokri mein na rakhein. Diversification aapko ek single stock ke kharab performance ke emotional impact se bachata hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.section3_l5: Stop-Loss Orders Set Karein: Pehle se decide karein ki aap ek position par maximum kitna loss sehne ko taiyar hain. Ek stop-loss order automatically stock ko bech deta hai agar woh us price par pahunch jaata hai, emotional decision ko aapke haathon se le leta hai.
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.conclusion_title: Conclusion: Aapka Dimag Aapka Sabse Bada Asset (ya Liability) Hai
the-investors-mind-managing-psychologica.conclusion_p1: Ek achhe investor aur ek great investor ke beech ka fark aksar temperament par aa jaata hai. Hum sab jin psychological biases ke shikar hote hain, unhe pehchan kar aur unka muqabla karne ke liye practical strategies implement karke, aap long-term investment success ke liye zaroori mental fortitude bana sakte hain. Apne emotions ko control karein, varna woh aapke portfolio ko control karenge.
